repository.corpname: University of Montana, Mansfield Library, Archives and Special Collections

origination.corpname: University of Montana (Missoula, Mont.) University Relations

did.unittitle: University of Montana (Missoula, Mont.) University Relations records
did.abstract: This collection consists of records of the University Relations department of the University of Montana-Missoula, including press releases documenting university events and athletics, as well as departmental and individual noteworthy achievements.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The University of Montana's University Relations department serves the public and the University by distributing accurate and timely information about UM, producing useful and interesting publications, and enhancing the UM brand and overall image of higher education through outreach, marketing activities, e-communications and social media.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes a variety of records and publications produced by the University of Montana's University Relations department including campus photographs, faculty biographies, and press releases. The majority of the collection is currently unprocessed, but a list of photographs and a chronological run of press releases is available.

arrangement.p: Press releases arranged chronologically. Some photographs have been arranged by subject and others are arranged chronologically.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must use collection in accordance with the policies of Archives and Special Collections, the Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, and The University of Montana-Missoula.

userestrict.p: Researchers are responsible for using in accordance with 17 U.S.C. and any other applicable statutes. Copyright held by The University of Montana

prefercite.p: University of Montana (Missoula, Mont.) University Relations, Archives and Special Collections, Maureen and Mike Mansfield Library, The University of Montana-Missoula.

custodhist.p: These materials were held by University Relations until their distribution (in the case of publications) or direct transfer (in the case of photographs and other unpublished materials) to the Archives.

acqinfo.p: These materials have been acquired over the course of decades. Not every transfer of materials has an accompanying accession record.

accruals.p: Additions to this collection of both published and unpublished materials are expected.

processinfo.p: Not all portions of this collection have been arranged and described at this time. Press releases have been arranged chronologically. Some photographs have been arranged by subject and others are arranged chronologically.

separatedmaterial.p: A portion of the published materials created by University Relations have been cataloged either as University Publications in the Archives 'UPUBs' collection or have general library call number and are housed in Archives and Special Collections or in the Library's general collection.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.

scopecontent.p: This series contains press releases created and distributed by University Relations to share information about campus individuals, events and activities.

processinfo.p: Physical copies of Press Releases are arranged in chronological order. The University of Montana News Releases online collection includes digitized copies of the releases in this collection as well as newer releases.

scopecontent.p: This series contains photographs taken by various University Photographers including Gerald Kling and Todd Goodrich. Subjects include campus buildings, faculty and administrators, campus events, and student activities. A variety of formats, including 35mm negatives, slides and prints are included. A rough inventory of these images is available at the Archives.

This series contains folders compiled by Information Services (University Relations) about UM employees but also about guest speakers, staff, graduate students, and student leaders for whom press releases were created. Folders often include biographical information collected by Information Services (University Relations) and some include photographs.
